source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: Tubes of 2.sNb zirconium alloy were fatigued in the tensiontension mode by cyclic internal pressures to cause axial crack growth and unstable fractures at room temperature.

source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: The $2 . 5 \mathsf { N b }$ zirconium alloy used in these tests was obtained from prototypic reactor pressure tubing.

source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_011_chunk1
evidence_span: The material conditions investigated were: $( a )$ cold-worked (30 to 60 percent reduction in area); $( b )$ heat-treated $( 8 8 0 \mathrm { C }$ soak for $5 ~ \mathrm { m i n }$ , water-quenched, 15 percent reduction in area, and aged 24 h at $5 0 0 \mathrm { C } )$ ; and (c) both the cold-worked and the heat-treated material hydrided to concentration levels of 200 to $3 0 0 \mathsf { p p m }$ .
